definition: theater chain (abbr. for 電影院線|电影院线)
thread/string/wire/line/CL:條|条[tiao2],股[gu3],根[gen1]/(after a number) tier (unofficial ranking of a Chinese city)

sentences.english: Now it appears it has a studio that will get it into theaters.
sentences.chinese: 現在看來已經有製片廠願意把它推廣到院線。

sentences.english: What will be the next global cinematic hot spot?
sentences.chinese: 全球院線的下個熱門點又將是什麼？

sentences.english: Compared to the same weekend last year, business was up 59 percent.
sentences.chinese: 相比於去年同期的週末，院線票房大增59%。

definition: (of a movie, show etc) to attract large audiences
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
golden branch, jade leaves (idiom); fig. blue-blooded nobility, esp. imperial kinsmen or peerless beauty
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
everyone present applauds/universal acclaim/a standing ovation/to bring the house down
lit. the dragon wars, the tiger battles (idiom); fierce battle between giants
mutual exchange of assistance (idiom)/to benefit from each other's strengths and make up each other's shortfalls/to reciprocate with material assistance/scratch each other's back
